hints.content: Start by understanding the problem statement clearly. You need to flip pairs of '+' signs into '-' signs. Consider how many flips you can make in a given string.
Think about how you can identify pairs of '+' signs in the string. A simple way to do this is to iterate through the string and look for consecutive '+' characters.
When you find a pair of '+' signs, you can replace them with '--'. Make sure to keep track of the changes you make to the string.
Consider using a loop to process the string. You might want to use a list to build the new string as you make your flips.
Remember that the string can have varying lengths. What happens if the string is empty or has only one character? Think about edge cases.
After flipping a pair, you should continue checking the string for more pairs. How will you ensure that you don't miss any pairs that overlap?
You need to return all possible states of the string after making the flips. Think about how to store these states. A set might be useful to avoid duplicates.
Consider how you will generate the next states. After flipping a pair, you should recursively generate new states until no more flips are possible.
Make sure to handle the case where no flips are possible. Your function should be able to return the original string if no pairs exist.
Finally, think about how to format your output. You should return a list of all unique strings that can be generated from the original string by flipping pairs of '+' signs.

questionNotes: The input string consists only of '+' and '-' characters.
You need to return all unique strings that can be formed by flipping pairs of '+' signs.
Consider edge cases like an empty string or strings with no '+' signs.
The output should be a list of strings, with no duplicates.
